org.kepler.job

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.job.Job

  • public class Job
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Job to describe a standalone job. It is assumed that a job will be submitted only once and then forgotten. Do not resubmit the same Job object but create another one.

      • status

        public JobStatusInfo status

    • Constructor Detail

      • Job

        protected Job(java.lang.String jobID)
        Constructor is called from JobFactory. jobID is a unique id for the jobs. Currently only for the current applications. Later it will be an uuid.

    • Method Detail

      • getJobID

        public java.lang.String getJobID()
        Get the key of the Job object in the hash table. Used by JobManager to create unique files based on Job's key Do not mix it with status.jobID, which is the real job id in the remote queue.

      • setNumTasks

        public void setNumTasks(int nt)

      • getNumTasks

        public int getNumTasks()

      • setExecutable

        public boolean setExecutable(java.lang.String executablePath,
                             boolean isLocal,
                             java.lang.String arguments)
                      throws JobException
        Set the executable for the job. executablePath is the path to the executable isLocal true means a local file, false means the executable is on the remote site arguments are the arguments to be passed to the job. This will work only if the submission file is created by the JobManager and not provided as is in the setSubmitFile() method.
        Returns:
        true if succeeds. Throws JobException if isLocal is true but executable is not found locally.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setInputFile

        public boolean setInputFile(java.lang.String path,
                            boolean isLocal)
                     throws JobException
        Set an input file for job. It can be either locally present or remotely.
        Returns:
        true at success, but throws JobException if file is assumed to be a local file and it does not exist.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setBinFile

        public void setBinFile(java.lang.String binFile,
                       boolean isLocal)
                throws JobException
        Set file to be staged to bin path. It can be either locally present or remotely. It is currently used for staging default fork script jmgr-fork.sh from job/resources
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setOtherInputFile

        public boolean setOtherInputFile(java.lang.String path)
                          throws JobException
        Set an "other" input file for job. It will be staged to the remote site into the remote working dir but it will not be used in creating the submission file.
        Returns:
        true at success, but throws JobException if file is assumed to be a local file and it does not exist.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setOutputFile

        public void setOutputFile(java.lang.String path)
                   throws JobException
        Set an output file for job. It should be the name of output file which will be produced by the job.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setLocalWorkdir

        public boolean setLocalWorkdir(java.lang.String path)
                        throws JobException
        Set and create the local working directory. For local execution, it will be the same as the working directory, so it is not necessary to set. For remote execution, the result of the remote job will be brought to this directory (not implemented!).
        Returns:
        true if creation succeeded, throws JobException otherwise
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setWorkdir

        public boolean setWorkdir(java.lang.String path)
        Set the (remote) working directory. The directory given as path must exist already. The actual working directory of a job will be this path appended with the job's myID. That directory will be created automatically and the job submission will be issued from this directory. I.e. relative input/output filenames in the job submission refer files under this directory. To get back the actual working directory name, use getWorkdirPath().
        Returns:
        if path==null, it returns false, otherwise true

      • setWorkdir

        public boolean setWorkdir(java.lang.String path,
                          boolean createUniqueSubdir)
        Set the (remote) working directory. If "createUniqueSubdir" is set to false, then the given dir is used as working dir. If "createUniqueSubdir" is set to true, the directory given as path must exist already and tThe actual working directory will be this path appended with the job's myID. That directory will be created automatically and the job submission will be issued from this directory. I.e. relative input/output filenames in the job submission refer files under this directory. To get back the actual working directory name, use getWorkdirPath().
        Returns:
        if path==null, it returns false, otherwise true

      • getLocalWorkdirPath

        public java.lang.String getLocalWorkdirPath()

      • getWorkdirPath

        public java.lang.String getWorkdirPath()

      • setSubmitFile

        public void setSubmitFile(java.lang.String submitFile,
                          boolean isItLocal)
                   throws JobException
        Give a predefined submit file for the job. This is the most general possibility for advanced users, to submit jobs to a specific job manager. For basic users, do not use this method. Just define the executable, input and output files for the Job and the JobManager will create an appropriate submit file for the selected job manager. !!!That is not implemented in the support classes, so you must use this method always!!!
        Throws:
        JobException

      • submit

        public java.lang.String submit(JobManager jobmanager,
                               boolean overwrite,
                               java.lang.String options)
                        throws JobException
        Submit a job, called from Job.submit(); boolean overwrite indicates whether old files that exist on the same directory should be removed before staging new files. As long jobIDs are not really unique, this is worth to be true. options can be a special options string for the actual jobmanager.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • reconnect

        public boolean reconnect(JobManager jobmanager)
                  throws JobException
        Reconnect to a executing job. As long jobIDs are not really unique, this is worth to be true. options can be a special options string for the actual jobmanager.
        Throws:
        JobException

      • status

        public boolean status()
               throws JobException
        Check the status of the job
        Throws:
        JobException

      • deleteFromQueue

        public boolean deleteFromQueue()
                        throws JobException
        Remove job from the queue (either running or waiting)
        Throws:
        JobException

      • setDependentJobs

        public void setDependentJobs(Job[] dependentJobs)
        Specify a set of jobs that must successfully complete before this can start.

      • getDependentJobs

        public Job[] getDependentJobs()
        Get a set of jobs that must successfully complete before this job can start. If there are none, returns null.

      • getSubmitFile

        public java.lang.String getSubmitFile()

      • isSubmitFileLocal

        protected boolean isSubmitFileLocal()

      • getBinFile

        protected java.lang.String getBinFile()

      • isBinFileLocal

        protected boolean isBinFileLocal()

      • getLocalFiles

        protected java.util.Vector getLocalFiles()
        Return vector of local files that should be staged to the remote site for a job. Vector elements are type of File!

      • getRemoteFiles

        protected java.util.Vector getRemoteFiles()
        Return vector of remote files that should be copied into to remote job directory before submission. Vector elements are type of Strings!
